# core.vectors.DotProduct { #optyx.core.vectors.DotProduct }

```python
core.vectors.DotProduct(left, right)
```

Dot product of two vectors: x Â· y = x[0]*y[0] + x[1]*y[1] + ... + x[n-1]*y[n-1].

This is a scalar expression representing the inner product.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name   | Type                                                                                                               | Description    | Default    |
|--------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------|------------|
| left   | [VectorVariable](`optyx.core.vectors.VectorVariable`) \| [VectorExpression](`optyx.core.vectors.VectorExpression`) | First vector.  | _required_ |
| right  | [VectorVariable](`optyx.core.vectors.VectorVariable`) \| [VectorExpression](`optyx.core.vectors.VectorExpression`) | Second vector. | _required_ |

## Example {.doc-section .doc-section-example}

>>> x = VectorVariable("x", 3)
>>> y = VectorVariable("y", 3)
>>> d = DotProduct(x, y)
>>> d.evaluate({"x[0]": 1, "x[1]": 2, "x[2]": 3, "y[0]": 4, "y[1]": 5, "y[2]": 6})
32.0
